module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.EventTypeSummary

-- | Returns information about an event that has triggered a notification
--   rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventTypeSummary</a> smart constructor.
data EventTypeSummary
EventTypeSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EventTypeSummary

-- | The resource type of the event.
[$sel:resourceType:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the event.
[$sel:eventTypeName:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The system-generated ID of the event.
[$sel:eventTypeId:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the service for which the event applies.
[$sel:serviceName:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventTypeSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>eventTypeSummary_eventTypeName</a> - The name of the event.

--   <a>$sel:eventTypeId:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_eventTypeId</a> - The system-generated ID of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:EventTypeSummary'</a>,

--   which the event applies.

module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.ListTargetsFilter

-- | Information about a filter to apply to the list of returned targets.
--   You can filter by target type, address, or status. For example, to
--   filter results to notification rules that have active Amazon SNS
--   topics as targets, you could specify a ListTargetsFilter Name as
--   TargetType and a Value of SNS, and a Name of TARGET_STATUS and a Value
--   of ACTIVE.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListTargetsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListTargetsFilter
ListTargetsFilter' :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text -> ListTargetsFilter

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
[$sel:name:ListTargetsFilter'] :: ListTargetsFilter -> ListTargetsFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets. For example, if you specify <i>SNS</i> for the Target type,
--   you could specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a topic as the
--   value.
[$sel:value:ListTargetsFilter'] :: ListTargetsFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTargetsFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ListTargetsFilter'</a>, <a>listTargetsFilter_value</a> -
--   The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets. For example, if you specify <i>SNS</i> for the Target type,
--   you could specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a topic as the
--   value.
newListTargetsFilter :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text -> ListTargetsFilter

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
listTargetsFilter_name :: Lens' ListTargetsFilter ListTargetsFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned

--   value.

module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.NotificationRuleSummary

-- | Information about a specified notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationRuleSummary</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationRuleSummary
NotificationRuleSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NotificationRuleSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
[$sel:arn:NotificationRuleSummary'] :: NotificationRuleSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of the notification rule.
[$sel:id:NotificationRuleSummary'] :: NotificationRuleSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationRuleSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:NotificationRuleSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notificationRuleSummary_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:NotificationRuleSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notificationRuleSummary_id</a> - The unique ID of the notification
--   rule.
newNotificationRuleSummary :: NotificationRuleSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
notificationRuleSummary_arn :: Lens' NotificationRuleSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique ID of the notification rule.
notificationRuleSummary_id :: Lens' NotificationRuleSummary (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.Target

-- | Information about the SNS topics associated with a notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTarget</a> smart constructor.
data Target
Target' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Target

-- | The target type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
[$sel:targetType:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
[$sel:targetAddress:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Target</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:Target'</a>, <a>target_targetType</a> - The target
--   type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:Target'</a>, <a>target_targetAddress</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
newTarget :: Target

-- | The target type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
target_targetType :: Lens' Target (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
target_targetAddress :: Lens' Target (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.Target.Target
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.Target.Target
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.Target.Target
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.Target.Target
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.Target.Target
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.Target.Target


module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus
newtype TargetStatus
TargetStatus' :: Text -> TargetStatus
[fromTargetStatus] :: TargetStatus -> Text
pattern TargetStatus_ACTIVE :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_DEACTIVATED :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_INACTIVE :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_PENDING :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_UNREACHABLE :: TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetStatus.TargetStatus


module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetSummary

-- | Information about the targets specified for a notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTargetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TargetSummary
TargetSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe TargetStatus -> TargetSummary

-- | The type of the target (for example, SNS).
[$sel:targetType:TargetSummary'] :: TargetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
[$sel:targetAddress:TargetSummary'] :: TargetSummary -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The status of the target.
[$sel:targetStatus:TargetSummary'] :: TargetSummary -> Maybe TargetStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>TargetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:TargetSummary'</a>, <a>targetSummary_targetType</a>
--   - The type of the target (for example, SNS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:TargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>targetSummary_targetAddress</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the SNS topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetStatus:TargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>targetSummary_targetStatus</a> - The status of the target.
newTargetSummary :: TargetSummary

-- | The type of the target (for example, SNS).
targetSummary_targetType :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
targetSummary_targetAddress :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the target.
targetSummary_targetStatus :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe TargetStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetSummary.TargetSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetSummary.TargetSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetSummary.TargetSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetSummary.TargetSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetSummary.TargetSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types.TargetSummary.TargetSummary


module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Types

-- | API version <tt>2019-10-15</tt> of the Amazon CodeStar Notifications
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | One or more parameter values are not valid.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS CodeStar Notifications can't create the notification rule because
--   you do not have sufficient permissions.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource with the same name or ID already exists. Notification rule
--   names must be unique in your AWS account.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Some or all of the configuration is incomplete, missing, or not valid.
_ConfigurationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS CodeStar Notifications can't complete the request because the
--   resource is being modified by another process. Wait a few minutes and
--   try again.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The value for the enumeration token used in the request to return the
--   next batch of the results is not valid.
_InvalidNextTokenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS CodeStar Notifications can't find a resource that matches the
--   provided ARN.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One of the AWS CodeStar Notifications limits has been exceeded. Limits
--   apply to accounts, notification rules, notifications, resources, and
--   targets. For more information, see Limits.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype DetailType
DetailType' :: Text -> DetailType
[fromDetailType] :: DetailType -> Text
pattern DetailType_BASIC :: DetailType
pattern DetailType_FULL :: DetailType
newtype ListEventTypesFilterName
ListEventTypesFilterName' :: Text -> ListEventTypesFilterName
[fromListEventTypesFilterName] :: ListEventTypesFilterName -> Text
pattern ListEventTypesFilterName_RESOURCE_TYPE :: ListEventTypesFilterName
pattern ListEventTypesFilterName_SERVICE_NAME :: ListEventTypesFilterName
newtype ListNotificationRulesFilterName
ListNotificationRulesFilterName' :: Text -> ListNotificationRulesFilterName
[fromListNotificationRulesFilterName] :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName -> Text
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_CREATED_BY :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_EVENT_TYPE_ID :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_RESOURCE :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_TARGET_ADDRESS :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
newtype ListTargetsFilterName
ListTargetsFilterName' :: Text -> ListTargetsFilterName
[fromListTargetsFilterName] :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text
pattern ListTargetsFilterName_TARGET_ADDRESS :: ListTargetsFilterName
pattern ListTargetsFilterName_TARGET_STATUS :: ListTargetsFilterName
pattern ListTargetsFilterName_TARGET_TYPE :: ListTargetsFilterName
newtype NotificationRuleStatus
NotificationRuleStatus' :: Text -> NotificationRuleStatus
[fromNotificationRuleStatus] :: NotificationRuleStatus -> Text
pattern NotificationRuleStatus_DISABLED :: NotificationRuleStatus
pattern NotificationRuleStatus_ENABLED :: NotificationRuleStatus
newtype TargetStatus
TargetStatus' :: Text -> TargetStatus
[fromTargetStatus] :: TargetStatus -> Text
pattern TargetStatus_ACTIVE :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_DEACTIVATED :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_INACTIVE :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_PENDING :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_UNREACHABLE :: TargetStatus

-- | Returns information about an event that has triggered a notification
--   rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventTypeSummary</a> smart constructor.
data EventTypeSummary
EventTypeSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EventTypeSummary

-- | The resource type of the event.
[$sel:resourceType:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the event.
[$sel:eventTypeName:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The system-generated ID of the event.
[$sel:eventTypeId:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the service for which the event applies.
[$sel:serviceName:EventTypeSummary'] :: EventTypeSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventTypeSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_resourceType</a> - The resource type of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeName:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_eventTypeName</a> - The name of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeId:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_eventTypeId</a> - The system-generated ID of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_serviceName</a> - The name of the service for
--   which the event applies.
newEventTypeSummary :: EventTypeSummary

-- | The resource type of the event.
eventTypeSummary_resourceType :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the event.
eventTypeSummary_eventTypeName :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The system-generated ID of the event.
eventTypeSummary_eventTypeId :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the service for which the event applies.
eventTypeSummary_serviceName :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about a filter to apply to the list of returned event
--   types. You can filter by resource type or service name.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListEventTypesFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListEventTypesFilter
ListEventTypesFilter' :: ListEventTypesFilterName -> Text -> ListEventTypesFilter

-- | The system-generated name of the filter type you want to filter by.
[$sel:name:ListEventTypesFilter'] :: ListEventTypesFilter -> ListEventTypesFilterName

-- | The name of the resource type (for example, pipeline) or service name
--   (for example, CodePipeline) that you want to filter by.
[$sel:value:ListEventTypesFilter'] :: ListEventTypesFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListEventTypesFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListEventTypesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypesFilter_name</a> - The system-generated name of the
--   filter type you want to filter by.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ListEventTypesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypesFilter_value</a> - The name of the resource type (for
--   example, pipeline) or service name (for example, CodePipeline) that
--   you want to filter by.
newListEventTypesFilter :: ListEventTypesFilterName -> Text -> ListEventTypesFilter

-- | The system-generated name of the filter type you want to filter by.
listEventTypesFilter_name :: Lens' ListEventTypesFilter ListEventTypesFilterName

-- | The name of the resource type (for example, pipeline) or service name
--   (for example, CodePipeline) that you want to filter by.
listEventTypesFilter_value :: Lens' ListEventTypesFilter Text

-- | Information about a filter to apply to the list of returned
--   notification rules. You can filter by event type, owner, resource, or
--   target.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListNotificationRulesFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListNotificationRulesFilter
ListNotificationRulesFilter' :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName -> Text -> ListNotificationRulesFilter

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   notification rules.
[$sel:name:ListNotificationRulesFilter'] :: ListNotificationRulesFilter -> ListNotificationRulesFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   notification rules. For example, if you specify filtering by
--   <i>RESOURCE</i> in Name, you might specify the ARN of a pipeline in
--   AWS CodePipeline for the value.
[$sel:value:ListNotificationRulesFilter'] :: ListNotificationRulesFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListNotificationRulesFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListNotificationRulesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listNotificationRulesFilter_name</a> - The name of the attribute
--   you want to use to filter the returned notification rules.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ListNotificationRulesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listNotificationRulesFilter_value</a> - The value of the attribute
--   you want to use to filter the returned notification rules. For
--   example, if you specify filtering by <i>RESOURCE</i> in Name, you
--   might specify the ARN of a pipeline in AWS CodePipeline for the value.
newListNotificationRulesFilter :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName -> Text -> ListNotificationRulesFilter

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   notification rules.
listNotificationRulesFilter_name :: Lens' ListNotificationRulesFilter ListNotificationRulesFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   notification rules. For example, if you specify filtering by
--   <i>RESOURCE</i> in Name, you might specify the ARN of a pipeline in
--   AWS CodePipeline for the value.
listNotificationRulesFilter_value :: Lens' ListNotificationRulesFilter Text

-- | Information about a filter to apply to the list of returned targets.
--   You can filter by target type, address, or status. For example, to
--   filter results to notification rules that have active Amazon SNS
--   topics as targets, you could specify a ListTargetsFilter Name as
--   TargetType and a Value of SNS, and a Name of TARGET_STATUS and a Value
--   of ACTIVE.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListTargetsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListTargetsFilter
ListTargetsFilter' :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text -> ListTargetsFilter

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
[$sel:name:ListTargetsFilter'] :: ListTargetsFilter -> ListTargetsFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets. For example, if you specify <i>SNS</i> for the Target type,
--   you could specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a topic as the
--   value.
[$sel:value:ListTargetsFilter'] :: ListTargetsFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTargetsFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListTargetsFilter'</a>, <a>listTargetsFilter_name</a> -
--   The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ListTargetsFilter'</a>, <a>listTargetsFilter_value</a> -
--   The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets. For example, if you specify <i>SNS</i> for the Target type,
--   you could specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a topic as the
--   value.
newListTargetsFilter :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text -> ListTargetsFilter

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
listTargetsFilter_name :: Lens' ListTargetsFilter ListTargetsFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets. For example, if you specify <i>SNS</i> for the Target type,
--   you could specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a topic as the
--   value.
listTargetsFilter_value :: Lens' ListTargetsFilter Text

-- | Information about a specified notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationRuleSummary</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationRuleSummary
NotificationRuleSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NotificationRuleSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
[$sel:arn:NotificationRuleSummary'] :: NotificationRuleSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of the notification rule.
[$sel:id:NotificationRuleSummary'] :: NotificationRuleSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationRuleSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:NotificationRuleSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notificationRuleSummary_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:NotificationRuleSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notificationRuleSummary_id</a> - The unique ID of the notification
--   rule.
newNotificationRuleSummary :: NotificationRuleSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
notificationRuleSummary_arn :: Lens' NotificationRuleSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique ID of the notification rule.
notificationRuleSummary_id :: Lens' NotificationRuleSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the SNS topics associated with a notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTarget</a> smart constructor.
data Target
Target' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Target

-- | The target type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
[$sel:targetType:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
[$sel:targetAddress:Target'] :: Target -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Target</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:Target'</a>, <a>target_targetType</a> - The target
--   type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:Target'</a>, <a>target_targetAddress</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
newTarget :: Target

-- | The target type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
target_targetType :: Lens' Target (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
target_targetAddress :: Lens' Target (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the targets specified for a notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTargetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TargetSummary
TargetSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe TargetStatus -> TargetSummary

-- | The type of the target (for example, SNS).
[$sel:targetType:TargetSummary'] :: TargetSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
[$sel:targetAddress:TargetSummary'] :: TargetSummary -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The status of the target.
[$sel:targetStatus:TargetSummary'] :: TargetSummary -> Maybe TargetStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>TargetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:TargetSummary'</a>, <a>targetSummary_targetType</a>
--   - The type of the target (for example, SNS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:TargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>targetSummary_targetAddress</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the SNS topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetStatus:TargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>targetSummary_targetStatus</a> - The status of the target.
newTargetSummary :: TargetSummary

-- | The type of the target (for example, SNS).
targetSummary_targetType :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
targetSummary_targetAddress :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the target.
targetSummary_targetStatus :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe TargetStatus)


-- | Associates a set of provided tags with a notification rule.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> HashMap Text Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule to tag.
[$sel:arn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | The list of tags to associate with the resource. Tag key names cannot
--   start with "aws".
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule to tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - The list of
--   tags to associate with the resource. Tag key names cannot start with
--   "aws".
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule to tag.
tagResource_arn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | The list of tags to associate with the resource. Tag key names cannot
--   start with "aws".
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The list of tags associated with the resource.
[$sel:tags:TagResourceResponse'] :: TagResourceResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'] :: TagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResourceResponse_tags</a> - The
--   list of tags associated with the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:TagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>tagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newTagResourceResponse :: Int -> TagResourceResponse

-- | The list of tags associated with the resource.
tagResourceResponse_tags :: Lens' TagResourceResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.TagResource.TagResource


-- | Creates an association between a notification rule and an SNS topic so
--   that the associated target can receive notifications when the events
--   described in the rule are triggered.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Subscribe

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscribe</a> smart constructor.
data Subscribe
Subscribe' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Target -> Subscribe

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:Subscribe'] :: Subscribe -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you
--   want to create the association.
[$sel:arn:Subscribe'] :: Subscribe -> Text
[$sel:target:Subscribe'] :: Subscribe -> Target

-- | Create a value of <a>Subscribe</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:Subscribe'</a>,
--   <a>subscribe_clientRequestToken</a> - An enumeration token that, when
--   provided in a request, returns the next batch of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Subscribe'</a>, <a>subscribe_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you want to create the
--   association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:Subscribe'</a>, <a>subscribe_target</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
newSubscribe :: Text -> Target -> Subscribe

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
subscribe_clientRequestToken :: Lens' Subscribe (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you
--   want to create the association.
subscribe_arn :: Lens' Subscribe Text

-- | Undocumented member.
subscribe_target :: Lens' Subscribe Target

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSubscribeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SubscribeResponse
SubscribeResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> SubscribeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you
--   have created assocations.
[$sel:arn:SubscribeResponse'] :: SubscribeResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SubscribeResponse'] :: SubscribeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SubscribeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Subscribe'</a>, <a>subscribeResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you have
--   created assocations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SubscribeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>subscribeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newSubscribeResponse :: Int -> SubscribeResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you
--   have created assocations.
subscribeResponse_arn :: Lens' SubscribeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
subscribeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SubscribeResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Subscribe.Subscribe

-- | Returns a list of the notification rule targets for an AWS account.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.ListTargets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTargets</a> smart constructor.
data ListTargets
ListTargets' :: Maybe [ListTargetsFilter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListTargets

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   Valid filters include target type, target address, and target status.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
[$sel:filters:ListTargets'] :: ListTargets -> Maybe [ListTargetsFilter]

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTargets'] :: ListTargets -> Maybe Text

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTargets'] :: ListTargets -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTargets</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ListTargets'</a>, <a>listTargets_filters</a> - The
--   filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   Valid filters include target type, target address, and target status.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTargets'</a>, <a>listTargets_nextToken</a> - An
--   enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the next
--   batch of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListTargets'</a>, <a>listTargets_maxResults</a> - A
--   non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results. The
--   maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
newListTargets :: ListTargets

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   Valid filters include target type, target address, and target status.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
listTargets_filters :: Lens' ListTargets (Maybe [ListTargetsFilter])

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
listTargets_nextToken :: Lens' ListTargets (Maybe Text)

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
listTargets_maxResults :: Lens' ListTargets (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTargetsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListTargetsResponse
ListTargetsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [TargetSummary] -> Int -> ListTargetsResponse

-- | An enumeration token that can be used in a request to return the next
--   batch of results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTargetsResponse'] :: ListTargetsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of notification rule targets.
[$sel:targets:ListTargetsResponse'] :: ListTargetsResponse -> Maybe [TargetSummary]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListTargetsResponse'] :: ListTargetsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTargetsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTargets'</a>,
--   <a>listTargetsResponse_nextToken</a> - An enumeration token that can
--   be used in a request to return the next batch of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:ListTargetsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listTargetsResponse_targets</a> - The list of notification rule
--   targets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListTargetsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listTargetsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListTargetsResponse :: Int -> ListTargetsResponse

-- | An enumeration token that can be used in a request to return the next
--   batch of results.
listTargetsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListTargetsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of notification rule targets.
listTargetsResponse_targets :: Lens' ListTargetsResponse (Maybe [TargetSummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listTargetsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTargetsResponse Int

-- | Returns a list of the notification rules for an AWS account.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.ListNotificationRules

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListNotificationRules</a> smart constructor.
data ListNotificationRules
ListNotificationRules' :: Maybe [ListNotificationRulesFilter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListNotificationRules

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   For valid values, see ListNotificationRulesFilter.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
[$sel:filters:ListNotificationRules'] :: ListNotificationRules -> Maybe [ListNotificationRulesFilter]

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListNotificationRules'] :: ListNotificationRules -> Maybe Text

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
[$sel:maxResults:ListNotificationRules'] :: ListNotificationRules -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListNotificationRules</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   information by service or resource type. For valid values, see
--   ListNotificationRulesFilter.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListNotificationRules'</a>,
--   <a>listNotificationRules_nextToken</a> - An enumeration token that,
--   when provided in a request, returns the next batch of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListNotificationRules'</a>,
--   <a>listNotificationRules_maxResults</a> - A non-negative integer used
--   to limit the number of returned results. The maximum number of results
--   that can be returned is 100.
newListNotificationRules :: ListNotificationRules

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   For valid values, see ListNotificationRulesFilter.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
listNotificationRules_filters :: Lens' ListNotificationRules (Maybe [ListNotificationRulesFilter])

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
listNotificationRules_nextToken :: Lens' ListNotificationRules (Maybe Text)

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
listNotificationRules_maxResults :: Lens' ListNotificationRules (Maybe Natural)

--   batch of the results.

--   Name (ARN) and ID.

--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Returns information about the event types available for configuring
--   notifications.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.ListEventTypes

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListEventTypes</a> smart constructor.
data ListEventTypes
ListEventTypes' :: Maybe [ListEventTypesFilter] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListEventTypes

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
[$sel:filters:ListEventTypes'] :: ListEventTypes -> Maybe [ListEventTypesFilter]

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListEventTypes'] :: ListEventTypes -> Maybe Text

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The default number is 50. The maximum number of results that can be
--   returned is 100.
[$sel:maxResults:ListEventTypes'] :: ListEventTypes -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListEventTypes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:ListEventTypes'</a>, <a>listEventTypes_filters</a> -
--   The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListEventTypes'</a>, <a>listEventTypes_nextToken</a>
--   - An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListEventTypes'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypes_maxResults</a> - A non-negative integer used to
--   limit the number of returned results. The default number is 50. The
--   maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
newListEventTypes :: ListEventTypes

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
listEventTypes_filters :: Lens' ListEventTypes (Maybe [ListEventTypesFilter])

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
listEventTypes_nextToken :: Lens' ListEventTypes (Maybe Text)

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The default number is 50. The maximum number of results that can be
--   returned is 100.
listEventTypes_maxResults :: Lens' ListEventTypes (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListEventTypesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListEventTypesResponse
ListEventTypesResponse' :: Maybe [EventTypeSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListEventTypesResponse

-- | Information about each event, including service name, resource type,
--   event ID, and event name.
[$sel:eventTypes:ListEventTypesResponse'] :: ListEventTypesResponse -> Maybe [EventTypeSummary]

-- | An enumeration token that can be used in a request to return the next
--   batch of the results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListEventTypesResponse'] :: ListEventTypesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListEventTypesResponse'] :: ListEventTypesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListEventTypesResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypes:ListEventTypesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypesResponse_eventTypes</a> - Information about each
--   event, including service name, resource type, event ID, and event
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListEventTypes'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypesResponse_nextToken</a> - An enumeration token that
--   can be used in a request to return the next batch of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListEventTypesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListEventTypesResponse :: Int -> ListEventTypesResponse

-- | Information about each event, including service name, resource type,
--   event ID, and event name.
listEventTypesResponse_eventTypes :: Lens' ListEventTypesResponse (Maybe [EventTypeSummary])

-- | An enumeration token that can be used in a request to return the next
--   batch of the results.
listEventTypesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListEventTypesResponse (Maybe Text)

listEventTypesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListEventTypesResponse Int

-- | Returns information about a specified notification rule.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.DescribeNotificationRule

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeNotificationRule</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeNotificationRule
DescribeNotificationRule' :: Text -> DescribeNotificationRule

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
[$sel:arn:DescribeNotificationRule'] :: DescribeNotificationRule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeNotificationRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DescribeNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRule_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the notification rule.
newDescribeNotificationRule :: Text -> DescribeNotificationRule

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
describeNotificationRule_arn :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRule Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeNotificationRuleResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeNotificationRuleResponse
DescribeNotificationRuleResponse' :: Maybe NotificationRuleStatus -> Maybe [EventTypeSummary] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DetailType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [TargetSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Int -> Text -> DescribeNotificationRuleResponse

-- | The status of the notification rule. Valid statuses are on (sending
--   notifications) or off (not sending notifications).
[$sel:status:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe NotificationRuleStatus

-- | A list of the event types associated with the notification rule.
[$sel:eventTypes:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe [EventTypeSummary]

-- | The date and time the notification rule was most recently updated, in
--   timestamp format.
[$sel:lastModifiedTimestamp:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name or email alias of the person who created the notification
--   rule.
[$sel:createdBy:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The level of detail included in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
[$sel:detailType:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe DetailType

-- | The name of the notification rule.
[$sel:name:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A list of the SNS topics associated with the notification rule.
[$sel:targets:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe [TargetSummary]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource associated with the
--   notification rule.
[$sel:resource:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time the notification rule was created, in timestamp
--   format.
[$sel:createdTimestamp:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The tags associated with the notification rule.
[$sel:tags:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
[$sel:arn:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'] :: DescribeNotificationRuleResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeNotificationRuleResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   off (not sending notifications).

--   timestamp format.

--   (ARN) of the notification rule.

--   notifications) or off (not sending notifications).

--   timestamp format.

--   rule.

--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.

--   notification rule.

--   format.

-- | Deletes a specified target for notifications.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.DeleteTarget

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteTarget</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteTarget
DeleteTarget' :: Maybe Bool -> Sensitive Text -> DeleteTarget

-- | A Boolean value that can be used to delete all associations with this
--   SNS topic. The default value is FALSE. If set to TRUE, all
--   associations between that target and every notification rule in your
--   AWS account are deleted.
[$sel:forceUnsubscribeAll:DeleteTarget'] :: DeleteTarget -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic to delete.
[$sel:targetAddress:DeleteTarget'] :: DeleteTarget -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteTarget</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceUnsubscribeAll:DeleteTarget'</a>,
--   <a>deleteTarget_forceUnsubscribeAll</a> - A Boolean value that can be
--   used to delete all associations with this SNS topic. The default value
--   is FALSE. If set to TRUE, all associations between that target and
--   every notification rule in your AWS account are deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:DeleteTarget'</a>,
--   <a>deleteTarget_targetAddress</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the SNS topic to delete.
newDeleteTarget :: Text -> DeleteTarget

-- | A Boolean value that can be used to delete all associations with this
--   SNS topic. The default value is FALSE. If set to TRUE, all
--   associations between that target and every notification rule in your
--   AWS account are deleted.
deleteTarget_forceUnsubscribeAll :: Lens' DeleteTarget (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic to delete.
deleteTarget_targetAddress :: Lens' DeleteTarget Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteTargetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteTargetResponse
DeleteTargetResponse' :: Int -> DeleteTargetResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteTargetResponse'] :: DeleteTargetResponse -> Int

--   omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteTargetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteTargetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

-- | Creates a notification rule for a resource. The rule specifies the
--   events you want notifications about and the targets (such as SNS
--   topics) where you want to receive them.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.CreateNotificationRule

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateNotificationRule</a> smart constructor.
data CreateNotificationRule
CreateNotificationRule' :: Maybe NotificationRuleStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Sensitive Text -> [Text] -> Text -> [Target] -> DetailType -> CreateNotificationRule

-- | The status of the notification rule. The default value is ENABLED. If
--   the status is set to DISABLED, notifications aren't sent for the
--   notification rule.
[$sel:status:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> Maybe NotificationRuleStatus

-- | A unique, client-generated idempotency token that, when provided in a
--   request, ensures the request cannot be repeated with a changed
--   parameter. If a request with the same parameters is received and a
--   token is included, the request returns information about the initial
--   request that used that token.
--   
--   The AWS SDKs prepopulate client request tokens. If you are using an
--   AWS SDK, an idempotency token is created for you.
[$sel:clientRequestToken:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags to apply to this notification rule. Key names cannot
--   start with "aws".
[$sel:tags:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name for the notification rule. Notifictaion rule names must be
--   unique in your AWS account.
[$sel:name:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> Sensitive Text

-- | A list of event types associated with this notification rule. For a
--   list of allowed events, see EventTypeSummary.
[$sel:eventTypeIds:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to associate with the
--   notification rule. Supported resources include pipelines in AWS
--   CodePipeline, repositories in AWS CodeCommit, and build projects in
--   AWS CodeBuild.
[$sel:resource:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> Text

-- | A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of SNS topics to associate with
--   the notification rule.
[$sel:targets:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> [Target]

-- | The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
[$sel:detailType:CreateNotificationRule'] :: CreateNotificationRule -> DetailType

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateNotificationRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_status</a> - The status of the notification
--   rule. The default value is ENABLED. If the status is set to DISABLED,
--   notifications aren't sent for the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_clientRequestToken</a> - A unique,
--   client-generated idempotency token that, when provided in a request,
--   ensures the request cannot be repeated with a changed parameter. If a
--   request with the same parameters is received and a token is included,
--   the request returns information about the initial request that used
--   that token.
--   
--   The AWS SDKs prepopulate client request tokens. If you are using an
--   AWS SDK, an idempotency token is created for you.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_tags</a> - A list of tags to apply to this
--   notification rule. Key names cannot start with "aws".
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_name</a> - The name for the notification
--   rule. Notifictaion rule names must be unique in your AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeIds:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_eventTypeIds</a> - A list of event types
--   associated with this notification rule. For a list of allowed events,
--   see EventTypeSummary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resource:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_resource</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the resource to associate with the notification rule.
--   Supported resources include pipelines in AWS CodePipeline,
--   repositories in AWS CodeCommit, and build projects in AWS CodeBuild.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_targets</a> - A list of Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) of SNS topics to associate with the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailType:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_detailType</a> - The level of detail to
--   include in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will include
--   only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS CloudWatch.
--   FULL will include any supplemental information provided by AWS
--   CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for which
--   the notification is created.
newCreateNotificationRule :: Text -> Text -> DetailType -> CreateNotificationRule

-- | The status of the notification rule. The default value is ENABLED. If
--   the status is set to DISABLED, notifications aren't sent for the
--   notification rule.
createNotificationRule_status :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule (Maybe NotificationRuleStatus)

-- | A unique, client-generated idempotency token that, when provided in a
--   request, ensures the request cannot be repeated with a changed
--   parameter. If a request with the same parameters is received and a
--   token is included, the request returns information about the initial
--   request that used that token.
--   
--   The AWS SDKs prepopulate client request tokens. If you are using an
--   AWS SDK, an idempotency token is created for you.
createNotificationRule_clientRequestToken :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags to apply to this notification rule. Key names cannot
--   start with "aws".
createNotificationRule_tags :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name for the notification rule. Notifictaion rule names must be
--   unique in your AWS account.
createNotificationRule_name :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule Text

-- | A list of event types associated with this notification rule. For a
--   list of allowed events, see EventTypeSummary.
createNotificationRule_eventTypeIds :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to associate with the
--   notification rule. Supported resources include pipelines in AWS
--   CodePipeline, repositories in AWS CodeCommit, and build projects in
--   AWS CodeBuild.
createNotificationRule_resource :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule Text

-- | A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of SNS topics to associate with
--   the notification rule.
createNotificationRule_targets :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule [Target]

-- | The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
createNotificationRule_detailType :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule DetailType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateNotificationRuleResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateNotificationRuleResponse
CreateNotificationRuleResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateNotificationRuleResponse

[$sel:arn:CreateNotificationRuleResponse'] :: CreateNotificationRuleResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:httpStatus:CreateNotificationRuleResponse'] :: CreateNotificationRuleResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateNotificationRuleResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CreateNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,

--   (ARN) of the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateNotificationRuleResponse :: Int -> CreateNotificationRuleResponse

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
createNotificationRuleResponse_arn :: Lens' CreateNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe Text)

createNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateNotificationRuleResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.CreateNotificationRule.CreateNotificationRule

instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.CreateNotificationRule.CreateNotificationRuleResponse

-- | Removes an association between a notification rule and an Amazon SNS
--   topic so that subscribers to that topic stop receiving notifications
--   when the events described in the rule are triggered.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribe</a> smart constructor.
data Unsubscribe
Unsubscribe' :: Text -> Sensitive Text -> Unsubscribe

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
[$sel:arn:Unsubscribe'] :: Unsubscribe -> Text

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to unsubscribe from the notification rule.
[$sel:targetAddress:Unsubscribe'] :: Unsubscribe -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Unsubscribe</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Unsubscribe'</a>, <a>unsubscribe_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:Unsubscribe'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribe_targetAddress</a> - The ARN of the SNS topic to
--   unsubscribe from the notification rule.
newUnsubscribe :: Text -> Text -> Unsubscribe

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
unsubscribe_arn :: Lens' Unsubscribe Text

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to unsubscribe from the notification rule.
unsubscribe_targetAddress :: Lens' Unsubscribe Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UnsubscribeResponse
UnsubscribeResponse' :: Int -> Text -> UnsubscribeResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UnsubscribeResponse'] :: UnsubscribeResponse -> Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the notification rule from which
--   you have removed a subscription.
[$sel:arn:UnsubscribeResponse'] :: UnsubscribeResponse -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UnsubscribeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UnsubscribeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Unsubscribe'</a>, <a>unsubscribeResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the notification rule from which you
--   have removed a subscription.
newUnsubscribeResponse :: Int -> Text -> UnsubscribeResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
unsubscribeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UnsubscribeResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the notification rule from which
--   you have removed a subscription.
unsubscribeResponse_arn :: Lens' UnsubscribeResponse Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.UnsubscribeResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.UnsubscribeResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.UnsubscribeResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.UnsubscribeResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.UnsubscribeResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Unsubscribe.Unsubscribe


-- | Removes the association between one or more provided tags and a
--   notification rule.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule from which to
--   remove the tags.
[$sel:arn:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The key names of the tags to remove.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule from which to remove the
--   tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   key names of the tags to remove.
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule from which to
--   remove the tags.
untagResource_arn :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The key names of the tags to remove.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResourceResponse
UntagResourceResponse' :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UntagResourceResponse'] :: UntagResourceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResourceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UntagResourceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>untagResourceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUntagResourceResponse :: Int -> UntagResourceResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UntagResource.UntagResource


-- | Updates a notification rule for a resource. You can change the events
--   that trigger the notification rule, the status of the rule, and the
--   targets that receive the notifications.
--   
--   To add or remove tags for a notification rule, you must use
--   TagResource and UntagResource.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateNotificationRule</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateNotificationRule
UpdateNotificationRule' :: Maybe NotificationRuleStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe DetailType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [Target] -> Text -> UpdateNotificationRule

-- | The status of the notification rule. Valid statuses include enabled
--   (sending notifications) or disabled (not sending notifications).
[$sel:status:UpdateNotificationRule'] :: UpdateNotificationRule -> Maybe NotificationRuleStatus

-- | A list of event types associated with this notification rule.
[$sel:eventTypeIds:UpdateNotificationRule'] :: UpdateNotificationRule -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
[$sel:detailType:UpdateNotificationRule'] :: UpdateNotificationRule -> Maybe DetailType

-- | The name of the notification rule.
[$sel:name:UpdateNotificationRule'] :: UpdateNotificationRule -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The address and type of the targets to receive notifications from this
--   notification rule.
[$sel:targets:UpdateNotificationRule'] :: UpdateNotificationRule -> Maybe [Target]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
[$sel:arn:UpdateNotificationRule'] :: UpdateNotificationRule -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateNotificationRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_status</a> - The status of the notification
--   rule. Valid statuses include enabled (sending notifications) or
--   disabled (not sending notifications).
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeIds:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_eventTypeIds</a> - A list of event types
--   associated with this notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailType:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_detailType</a> - The level of detail to
--   include in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will include
--   only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS CloudWatch.
--   FULL will include any supplemental information provided by AWS
--   CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for which
--   the notification is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_name</a> - The name of the notification
--   rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_targets</a> - The address and type of the
--   targets to receive notifications from this notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the notification rule.
newUpdateNotificationRule :: Text -> UpdateNotificationRule

-- | The status of the notification rule. Valid statuses include enabled
--   (sending notifications) or disabled (not sending notifications).
updateNotificationRule_status :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe NotificationRuleStatus)

-- | A list of event types associated with this notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_eventTypeIds :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe [Text])

-- | The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
updateNotificationRule_detailType :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe DetailType)

-- | The name of the notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_name :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The address and type of the targets to receive notifications from this
--   notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_targets :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe [Target])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_arn :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateNotificationRuleResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateNotificationRuleResponse
UpdateNotificationRuleResponse' :: Int -> UpdateNotificationRuleResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateNotificationRuleResponse'] :: UpdateNotificationRuleResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateNotificationRuleResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newUpdateNotificationRuleResponse :: Int -> UpdateNotificationRuleResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRuleResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRuleResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRuleResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRuleResponse
