instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.UpdateNotificationRule.UpdateNotificationRule


module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Lens

-- | The status of the notification rule. The default value is ENABLED. If
--   the status is set to DISABLED, notifications aren't sent for the
--   notification rule.
createNotificationRule_status :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule (Maybe NotificationRuleStatus)

-- | A unique, client-generated idempotency token that, when provided in a
--   request, ensures the request cannot be repeated with a changed
--   parameter. If a request with the same parameters is received and a
--   token is included, the request returns information about the initial
--   request that used that token.
--   
--   The AWS SDKs prepopulate client request tokens. If you are using an
--   AWS SDK, an idempotency token is created for you.
createNotificationRule_clientRequestToken :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags to apply to this notification rule. Key names cannot
--   start with "aws".
createNotificationRule_tags :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name for the notification rule. Notifictaion rule names must be
--   unique in your AWS account.
createNotificationRule_name :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule Text

-- | A list of event types associated with this notification rule. For a
--   list of allowed events, see EventTypeSummary.
createNotificationRule_eventTypeIds :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to associate with the
--   notification rule. Supported resources include pipelines in AWS
--   CodePipeline, repositories in AWS CodeCommit, and build projects in
--   AWS CodeBuild.
createNotificationRule_resource :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule Text

-- | A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of SNS topics to associate with
--   the notification rule.
createNotificationRule_targets :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule [Target]

-- | The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
createNotificationRule_detailType :: Lens' CreateNotificationRule DetailType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
createNotificationRuleResponse_arn :: Lens' CreateNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
createNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateNotificationRuleResponse Int

-- | The status of the notification rule. Valid statuses include enabled
--   (sending notifications) or disabled (not sending notifications).
updateNotificationRule_status :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe NotificationRuleStatus)

-- | A list of event types associated with this notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_eventTypeIds :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe [Text])

-- | The level of detail to include in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
updateNotificationRule_detailType :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe DetailType)

-- | The name of the notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_name :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The address and type of the targets to receive notifications from this
--   notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_targets :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule (Maybe [Target])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
updateNotificationRule_arn :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRule Text

-- | The response's http status code.
updateNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateNotificationRuleResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule you want to
--   delete.
deleteNotificationRule_arn :: Lens' DeleteNotificationRule Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the deleted notification rule.
deleteNotificationRuleResponse_arn :: Lens' DeleteNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteNotificationRuleResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the notification rule.
listTagsForResource_arn :: Lens' ListTagsForResource Text

-- | The tags associated with the notification rule.
listTagsForResourceResponse_tags :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
listTagsForResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse Int

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
listEventTypes_filters :: Lens' ListEventTypes (Maybe [ListEventTypesFilter])

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
listEventTypes_nextToken :: Lens' ListEventTypes (Maybe Text)

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The default number is 50. The maximum number of results that can be
--   returned is 100.
listEventTypes_maxResults :: Lens' ListEventTypes (Maybe Natural)

-- | Information about each event, including service name, resource type,
--   event ID, and event name.
listEventTypesResponse_eventTypes :: Lens' ListEventTypesResponse (Maybe [EventTypeSummary])

-- | An enumeration token that can be used in a request to return the next
--   batch of the results.
listEventTypesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListEventTypesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listEventTypesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListEventTypesResponse Int

-- | A Boolean value that can be used to delete all associations with this
--   SNS topic. The default value is FALSE. If set to TRUE, all
--   associations between that target and every notification rule in your
--   AWS account are deleted.
deleteTarget_forceUnsubscribeAll :: Lens' DeleteTarget (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic to delete.
deleteTarget_targetAddress :: Lens' DeleteTarget Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteTargetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteTargetResponse Int

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   For valid values, see ListNotificationRulesFilter.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
listNotificationRules_filters :: Lens' ListNotificationRules (Maybe [ListNotificationRulesFilter])

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
listNotificationRules_nextToken :: Lens' ListNotificationRules (Maybe Text)

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
listNotificationRules_maxResults :: Lens' ListNotificationRules (Maybe Natural)

-- | An enumeration token that can be used in a request to return the next
--   batch of the results.
listNotificationRulesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListNotificationRulesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of notification rules for the AWS account, by Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) and ID.
listNotificationRulesResponse_notificationRules :: Lens' ListNotificationRulesResponse (Maybe [NotificationRuleSummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listNotificationRulesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListNotificationRulesResponse Int

-- | The filters to use to return information by service or resource type.
--   Valid filters include target type, target address, and target status.
--   
--   A filter with the same name can appear more than once when used with
--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.
listTargets_filters :: Lens' ListTargets (Maybe [ListTargetsFilter])

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
listTargets_nextToken :: Lens' ListTargets (Maybe Text)

-- | A non-negative integer used to limit the number of returned results.
--   The maximum number of results that can be returned is 100.
listTargets_maxResults :: Lens' ListTargets (Maybe Natural)

-- | An enumeration token that can be used in a request to return the next
--   batch of results.
listTargetsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListTargetsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of notification rule targets.
listTargetsResponse_targets :: Lens' ListTargetsResponse (Maybe [TargetSummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listTargetsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTargetsResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule to tag.
tagResource_arn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | The list of tags to associate with the resource. Tag key names cannot
--   start with "aws".
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The list of tags associated with the resource.
tagResourceResponse_tags :: Lens' TagResourceResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
tagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' TagResourceResponse Int

-- | An enumeration token that, when provided in a request, returns the
--   next batch of the results.
subscribe_clientRequestToken :: Lens' Subscribe (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you
--   want to create the association.
subscribe_arn :: Lens' Subscribe Text

-- | Undocumented member.
subscribe_target :: Lens' Subscribe Target

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you
--   have created assocations.
subscribeResponse_arn :: Lens' SubscribeResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
subscribeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SubscribeResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule from which to
--   remove the tags.
untagResource_arn :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The key names of the tags to remove.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
untagResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UntagResourceResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
unsubscribe_arn :: Lens' Unsubscribe Text

-- | The ARN of the SNS topic to unsubscribe from the notification rule.
unsubscribe_targetAddress :: Lens' Unsubscribe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
unsubscribeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UnsubscribeResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the notification rule from which
--   you have removed a subscription.
unsubscribeResponse_arn :: Lens' UnsubscribeResponse Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
describeNotificationRule_arn :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRule Text

-- | The status of the notification rule. Valid statuses are on (sending
--   notifications) or off (not sending notifications).
describeNotificationRuleResponse_status :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe NotificationRuleStatus)

-- | A list of the event types associated with the notification rule.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_eventTypes :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe [EventTypeSummary])

-- | The date and time the notification rule was most recently updated, in
--   timestamp format.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_lastModifiedTimestamp :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name or email alias of the person who created the notification
--   rule.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_createdBy :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The level of detail included in the notifications for this resource.
--   BASIC will include only the contents of the event as it would appear
--   in AWS CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information
--   provided by AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the
--   resource for which the notification is created.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_detailType :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe DetailType)

-- | The name of the notification rule.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_name :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the SNS topics associated with the notification rule.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_targets :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe [TargetSummary])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource associated with the
--   notification rule.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_resource :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time the notification rule was created, in timestamp
--   format.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_createdTimestamp :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The tags associated with the notification rule.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_tags :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The response's http status code.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse Int

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
describeNotificationRuleResponse_arn :: Lens' DescribeNotificationRuleResponse Text

-- | The resource type of the event.
eventTypeSummary_resourceType :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the event.
eventTypeSummary_eventTypeName :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The system-generated ID of the event.
eventTypeSummary_eventTypeId :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the service for which the event applies.
eventTypeSummary_serviceName :: Lens' EventTypeSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The system-generated name of the filter type you want to filter by.
listEventTypesFilter_name :: Lens' ListEventTypesFilter ListEventTypesFilterName

-- | The name of the resource type (for example, pipeline) or service name
--   (for example, CodePipeline) that you want to filter by.
listEventTypesFilter_value :: Lens' ListEventTypesFilter Text

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   notification rules.
listNotificationRulesFilter_name :: Lens' ListNotificationRulesFilter ListNotificationRulesFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   notification rules. For example, if you specify filtering by
--   <i>RESOURCE</i> in Name, you might specify the ARN of a pipeline in
--   AWS CodePipeline for the value.
listNotificationRulesFilter_value :: Lens' ListNotificationRulesFilter Text

-- | The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
listTargetsFilter_name :: Lens' ListTargetsFilter ListTargetsFilterName

-- | The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets. For example, if you specify <i>SNS</i> for the Target type,
--   you could specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a topic as the
--   value.
listTargetsFilter_value :: Lens' ListTargetsFilter Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
notificationRuleSummary_arn :: Lens' NotificationRuleSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique ID of the notification rule.
notificationRuleSummary_id :: Lens' NotificationRuleSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The target type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
target_targetType :: Lens' Target (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
target_targetAddress :: Lens' Target (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the target (for example, SNS).
targetSummary_targetType :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
targetSummary_targetAddress :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the target.
targetSummary_targetStatus :: Lens' TargetSummary (Maybe TargetStatus)


module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2019-10-15</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   This AWS CodeStar Notifications API Reference provides descriptions
--   and usage examples of the operations and data types for the AWS
--   CodeStar Notifications API. You can use the AWS CodeStar Notifications
--   API to work with the following objects:
--   
--   Notification rules, by calling the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateNotificationRule, which creates a notification rule for a
--   resource in your account.</li>
--   <li>DeleteNotificationRule, which deletes a notification rule.</li>
--   <li>DescribeNotificationRule, which provides information about a
--   notification rule.</li>
--   <li>ListNotificationRules, which lists the notification rules
--   associated with your account.</li>
--   <li>UpdateNotificationRule, which changes the name, events, or targets
--   associated with a notification rule.</li>
--   <li>Subscribe, which subscribes a target to a notification rule.</li>
--   <li>Unsubscribe, which removes a target from a notification rule.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Targets, by calling the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DeleteTarget, which removes a notification rule target (SNS topic)
--   from a notification rule.</li>
--   <li>ListTargets, which lists the targets associated with a
--   notification rule.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Events, by calling the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ListEventTypes, which lists the event types you can include in a
--   notification rule.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Tags, by calling the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ListTagsForResource, which lists the tags already associated with
--   a notification rule in your account.</li>
--   <li>TagResource, which associates a tag you provide with a
--   notification rule in your account.</li>
--   <li>UntagResource, which removes a tag from a notification rule in
--   your account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For information about how to use AWS CodeStar Notifications, see link
--   in the CodeStarNotifications User Guide.
module Network.AWS.CodeStarNotifications

-- | API version <tt>2019-10-15</tt> of the Amazon CodeStar Notifications
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | One or more parameter values are not valid.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS CodeStar Notifications can't create the notification rule because
--   you do not have sufficient permissions.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource with the same name or ID already exists. Notification rule
--   names must be unique in your AWS account.
_ResourceAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Some or all of the configuration is incomplete, missing, or not valid.
_ConfigurationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS CodeStar Notifications can't complete the request because the
--   resource is being modified by another process. Wait a few minutes and
--   try again.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The value for the enumeration token used in the request to return the
--   next batch of the results is not valid.
_InvalidNextTokenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS CodeStar Notifications can't find a resource that matches the
--   provided ARN.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One of the AWS CodeStar Notifications limits has been exceeded. Limits
--   apply to accounts, notification rules, notifications, resources, and
--   targets. For more information, see Limits.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateNotificationRule</a> smart constructor.
data CreateNotificationRule
CreateNotificationRule' :: Maybe NotificationRuleStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Sensitive Text -> [Text] -> Text -> [Target] -> DetailType -> CreateNotificationRule

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateNotificationRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_status</a> - The status of the notification
--   rule. The default value is ENABLED. If the status is set to DISABLED,
--   notifications aren't sent for the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientRequestToken:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_clientRequestToken</a> - A unique,
--   client-generated idempotency token that, when provided in a request,
--   ensures the request cannot be repeated with a changed parameter. If a
--   request with the same parameters is received and a token is included,
--   the request returns information about the initial request that used
--   that token.
--   
--   The AWS SDKs prepopulate client request tokens. If you are using an
--   AWS SDK, an idempotency token is created for you.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_tags</a> - A list of tags to apply to this
--   notification rule. Key names cannot start with "aws".
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_name</a> - The name for the notification
--   rule. Notifictaion rule names must be unique in your AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeIds:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_eventTypeIds</a> - A list of event types
--   associated with this notification rule. For a list of allowed events,
--   see EventTypeSummary.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resource:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_resource</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the resource to associate with the notification rule.
--   Supported resources include pipelines in AWS CodePipeline,
--   repositories in AWS CodeCommit, and build projects in AWS CodeBuild.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_targets</a> - A list of Amazon Resource
--   Names (ARNs) of SNS topics to associate with the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailType:CreateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRule_detailType</a> - The level of detail to
--   include in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will include
--   only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS CloudWatch.
--   FULL will include any supplemental information provided by AWS
--   CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for which
--   the notification is created.
newCreateNotificationRule :: Text -> Text -> DetailType -> CreateNotificationRule

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateNotificationRuleResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateNotificationRuleResponse
CreateNotificationRuleResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateNotificationRuleResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateNotificationRuleResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CreateNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRuleResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateNotificationRuleResponse :: Int -> CreateNotificationRuleResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateNotificationRule</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateNotificationRule
UpdateNotificationRule' :: Maybe NotificationRuleStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe DetailType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [Target] -> Text -> UpdateNotificationRule

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateNotificationRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_status</a> - The status of the notification
--   rule. Valid statuses include enabled (sending notifications) or
--   disabled (not sending notifications).
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeIds:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_eventTypeIds</a> - A list of event types
--   associated with this notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailType:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_detailType</a> - The level of detail to
--   include in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will include
--   only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS CloudWatch.
--   FULL will include any supplemental information provided by AWS
--   CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for which
--   the notification is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_name</a> - The name of the notification
--   rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_targets</a> - The address and type of the
--   targets to receive notifications from this notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UpdateNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>updateNotificationRule_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the notification rule.
newUpdateNotificationRule :: Text -> UpdateNotificationRule

--   constructor.

--   used to delete all associations with this SNS topic. The default value
--   is FALSE. If set to TRUE, all associations between that target and
--   every notification rule in your AWS account are deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:DeleteTarget'</a>,
--   <a>deleteTarget_targetAddress</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the SNS topic to delete.

--   OR statements. Filters with different names should be applied with AND
--   statements.

--

--   Name (ARN) of the notification rule for which you want to create the
--   association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:Subscribe'</a>, <a>subscribe_target</a> - Undocumented
--   member.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribe</a> smart constructor.
data Unsubscribe
Unsubscribe' :: Text -> Sensitive Text -> Unsubscribe

-- | Create a value of <a>Unsubscribe</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Unsubscribe'</a>, <a>unsubscribe_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:Unsubscribe'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribe_targetAddress</a> - The ARN of the SNS topic to
--   unsubscribe from the notification rule.
newUnsubscribe :: Text -> Text -> Unsubscribe

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUnsubscribeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UnsubscribeResponse
UnsubscribeResponse' :: Int -> Text -> UnsubscribeResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UnsubscribeResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UnsubscribeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>unsubscribeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Unsubscribe'</a>, <a>unsubscribeResponse_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the notification rule from which you
--   have removed a subscription.
newUnsubscribeResponse :: Int -> Text -> UnsubscribeResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeNotificationRule</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeNotificationRule
DescribeNotificationRule' :: Text -> DescribeNotificationRule

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeNotificationRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DescribeNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRule_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the notification rule.
newDescribeNotificationRule :: Text -> DescribeNotificationRule

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeNotificationRuleResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeNotificationRuleResponse
DescribeNotificationRuleResponse' :: Maybe NotificationRuleStatus -> Maybe [EventTypeSummary] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DetailType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [TargetSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Int -> Text -> DescribeNotificationRuleResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeNotificationRuleResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_status</a> - The status of the
--   notification rule. Valid statuses are on (sending notifications) or
--   off (not sending notifications).
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypes:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_eventTypes</a> - A list of the
--   event types associated with the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModifiedTimestamp:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_lastModifiedTimestamp</a> - The
--   date and time the notification rule was most recently updated, in
--   timestamp format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdBy:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_createdBy</a> - The name or email
--   alias of the person who created the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:detailType:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_detailType</a> - The level of
--   detail included in the notifications for this resource. BASIC will
--   include only the contents of the event as it would appear in AWS
--   CloudWatch. FULL will include any supplemental information provided by
--   AWS CodeStar Notifications and/or the service for the resource for
--   which the notification is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_name</a> - The name of the
--   notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_targets</a> - A list of the SNS
--   topics associated with the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resource:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_resource</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the resource associated with the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTimestamp:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_createdTimestamp</a> - The date
--   and time the notification rule was created, in timestamp format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_tags</a> - The tags associated
--   with the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeNotificationRuleResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DescribeNotificationRule'</a>,
--   <a>describeNotificationRuleResponse_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the notification rule.
newDescribeNotificationRuleResponse :: Int -> Text -> DescribeNotificationRuleResponse
newtype DetailType
DetailType' :: Text -> DetailType
[fromDetailType] :: DetailType -> Text
pattern DetailType_BASIC :: DetailType
pattern DetailType_FULL :: DetailType
newtype ListEventTypesFilterName
ListEventTypesFilterName' :: Text -> ListEventTypesFilterName
[fromListEventTypesFilterName] :: ListEventTypesFilterName -> Text
pattern ListEventTypesFilterName_RESOURCE_TYPE :: ListEventTypesFilterName
pattern ListEventTypesFilterName_SERVICE_NAME :: ListEventTypesFilterName
newtype ListNotificationRulesFilterName
ListNotificationRulesFilterName' :: Text -> ListNotificationRulesFilterName
[fromListNotificationRulesFilterName] :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName -> Text
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_CREATED_BY :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_EVENT_TYPE_ID :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_RESOURCE :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
pattern ListNotificationRulesFilterName_TARGET_ADDRESS :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName
newtype ListTargetsFilterName
ListTargetsFilterName' :: Text -> ListTargetsFilterName
[fromListTargetsFilterName] :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text
pattern ListTargetsFilterName_TARGET_ADDRESS :: ListTargetsFilterName
pattern ListTargetsFilterName_TARGET_STATUS :: ListTargetsFilterName
pattern ListTargetsFilterName_TARGET_TYPE :: ListTargetsFilterName
newtype NotificationRuleStatus
NotificationRuleStatus' :: Text -> NotificationRuleStatus
[fromNotificationRuleStatus] :: NotificationRuleStatus -> Text
pattern NotificationRuleStatus_DISABLED :: NotificationRuleStatus
pattern NotificationRuleStatus_ENABLED :: NotificationRuleStatus
newtype TargetStatus
TargetStatus' :: Text -> TargetStatus
[fromTargetStatus] :: TargetStatus -> Text
pattern TargetStatus_ACTIVE :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_DEACTIVATED :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_INACTIVE :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_PENDING :: TargetStatus
pattern TargetStatus_UNREACHABLE :: TargetStatus

-- | Returns information about an event that has triggered a notification
--   rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventTypeSummary</a> smart constructor.
data EventTypeSummary
EventTypeSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EventTypeSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>EventTypeSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_resourceType</a> - The resource type of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeName:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_eventTypeName</a> - The name of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeId:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_eventTypeId</a> - The system-generated ID of the
--   event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:EventTypeSummary'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeSummary_serviceName</a> - The name of the service for
--   which the event applies.
newEventTypeSummary :: EventTypeSummary

-- | Information about a filter to apply to the list of returned event
--   types. You can filter by resource type or service name.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListEventTypesFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListEventTypesFilter
ListEventTypesFilter' :: ListEventTypesFilterName -> Text -> ListEventTypesFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListEventTypesFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListEventTypesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypesFilter_name</a> - The system-generated name of the
--   filter type you want to filter by.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ListEventTypesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listEventTypesFilter_value</a> - The name of the resource type (for
--   example, pipeline) or service name (for example, CodePipeline) that
--   you want to filter by.
newListEventTypesFilter :: ListEventTypesFilterName -> Text -> ListEventTypesFilter

-- | Information about a filter to apply to the list of returned
--   notification rules. You can filter by event type, owner, resource, or
--   target.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListNotificationRulesFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListNotificationRulesFilter
ListNotificationRulesFilter' :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName -> Text -> ListNotificationRulesFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListNotificationRulesFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListNotificationRulesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listNotificationRulesFilter_name</a> - The name of the attribute
--   you want to use to filter the returned notification rules.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ListNotificationRulesFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listNotificationRulesFilter_value</a> - The value of the attribute
--   you want to use to filter the returned notification rules. For
--   example, if you specify filtering by <i>RESOURCE</i> in Name, you
--   might specify the ARN of a pipeline in AWS CodePipeline for the value.
newListNotificationRulesFilter :: ListNotificationRulesFilterName -> Text -> ListNotificationRulesFilter

-- | Information about a filter to apply to the list of returned targets.
--   You can filter by target type, address, or status. For example, to
--   filter results to notification rules that have active Amazon SNS
--   topics as targets, you could specify a ListTargetsFilter Name as
--   TargetType and a Value of SNS, and a Name of TARGET_STATUS and a Value
--   of ACTIVE.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListTargetsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListTargetsFilter
ListTargetsFilter' :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text -> ListTargetsFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTargetsFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListTargetsFilter'</a>, <a>listTargetsFilter_name</a> -
--   The name of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ListTargetsFilter'</a>, <a>listTargetsFilter_value</a> -
--   The value of the attribute you want to use to filter the returned
--   targets. For example, if you specify <i>SNS</i> for the Target type,
--   you could specify an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a topic as the
--   value.
newListTargetsFilter :: ListTargetsFilterName -> Text -> ListTargetsFilter

-- | Information about a specified notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationRuleSummary</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationRuleSummary
NotificationRuleSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NotificationRuleSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationRuleSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:NotificationRuleSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notificationRuleSummary_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the notification rule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:NotificationRuleSummary'</a>,
--   <a>notificationRuleSummary_id</a> - The unique ID of the notification
--   rule.
newNotificationRuleSummary :: NotificationRuleSummary

-- | Information about the SNS topics associated with a notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTarget</a> smart constructor.
data Target
Target' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Target

-- | Create a value of <a>Target</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:Target'</a>, <a>target_targetType</a> - The target
--   type. Can be an Amazon SNS topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:Target'</a>, <a>target_targetAddress</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic.
newTarget :: Target

-- | Information about the targets specified for a notification rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTargetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data TargetSummary
TargetSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe TargetStatus -> TargetSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>TargetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetType:TargetSummary'</a>, <a>targetSummary_targetType</a>
--   - The type of the target (for example, SNS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetAddress:TargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>targetSummary_targetAddress</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the SNS topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetStatus:TargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>targetSummary_targetStatus</a> - The status of the target.
newTargetSummary :: TargetSummary
